did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: George Webb was a cattleman and farmer in Arizona as well as an Associate Judge of the Tribal Court, 1942-1950. This collection includes the author's original typescript of sketches of Pima history and traditions.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: A Pima Remembers (AZ 154). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Cattleman and farmer, Arizona. Associate Judge of the Tribal Court, 1942-1950.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 2 series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Author's original typescript of sketches of Pima history and traditions. Includes revisions with editor's notes; correspondence, designs, financial records pertaining to the book's publication; original drawings by Webb of early scenes; and photographs of Webb, his daughter and friends. Also includes the legend of White Clay Potter which did not appear in the book.

relatedmaterial.p: Published as A Pima Remembers, University of Arizona Press, 1959.
